faq.title: What is your style of photography?
faq.content: I would say that my style of photography is a mixture of creative portraiture and documentary. I set aside time before the ceremony to take gorgeous portraits of you and then again during the couple shoot after the ceremony. In between this, for example when you are getting ready, during the ceremony and the reception I take documentary  / photo journalistic pictures where I capture the spontaneous moments. These images will show all the emotion that happens on a wedding day.

faq.title: How do I know how many hours of photography I need at my wedding?
faq.content: I like to arrive at the venue approx. 3 hour before we have to leave for the ceremony.  I need this time to photograph the reception, the venue, your pretty details, document the getting ready part of the day and then do your portraits. After the ceremony I spend approx. 1 – 1.5 hours for all the pics – the family shoot, bridal party shoot and your couple shoot. You can then calculate how long you would like me to stay at the reception.

faq.title: When is the best time to do the couple shoot at the wedding?
faq.content: 1 hour before sunset. I will be able to work it out for you and suggest what time we start the shoot.

faq.title: Is there anything I can do to help me get great pictures at my wedding?
faq.content: There are lots of things you can do to ensure you get great pics on your date! Getting Ready Photos
